name: places/ChIJdYhyVgtZwokR-mm-jZs7ssg
formattedAddress: 275 W 73rd St, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 275 W 73rd St, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text:
Catalonia 2023 was the first ICBT for my wife and me, and it was one of the best tours we have ever been on - period.
The pace of the tour, the variety of locations, the knowledge of the guides, and access we received were just impossible to get on our own. It didn’t feel like a tour, it felt like being part of a little family exploring Catalonia.
The food, the beer, the scenery, the history - just wow. This tour made us fall in love with Spain, and we hope to join another ICBT tour around the world soon.

originalText.text:
The ICBT experience is such a special, unique one - very hard to put into words. My wife and I took our first trip with them for the Catalonia '23 tour. The knowledge of the guides, and their deep connections to the brewing industry, make this truly different than a city or regional tour.

While seeing a few larger and more traditional tour sights along the way, many of our stops were off the beaten path - oftentimes places we would not be able to (or even know to) access without the insight and relationships with local producers that Joel and team have built over the years. We were welcomed into breweries, farms, wineries (cava) and homes like we were members of the family.

Getting to experience the personalities of the region through the lens of the local beer and food scene gave us an interesting understanding of the people and their culture. Combined with the beautiful sights we saw throughout Barcelona and the surrounding region, our ICBT trip was an unforgettable experience. We are already planning our next trip with ICBT, and can't wait to spend more time with the team on further journeys.

originalText.text:
As someone who enjoyed visiting the many breweries, the activities in conjunction with the tour were fun and educational such as a boat tour of Bamberg along the beautiful river Regnitz, a hike in the canopy of a Franconian forest that included climbing a tree tower which once topped over looked a very beautiful and breathtaking Franconian countryside , and a visit to the lovely and historical Plassenburg Castle in Bavaria. In addition, many independent excursion to local shops and markets were made available to us in order to interact with a very friendly and welcoming local populace.
Richard

originalText.text:
Though my son and I appreciate beer, we knew little about what went on besides the enjoyment of a good pint.  That said, in a comfortable, interesting way, we learned much about beer’s history, and its at times, highly complex brewing process.
I found the entire experience truly unique and greatly enjoyable. Joel, and the tour’s supporting staff, were always helpful, courteous, and humorous, and they (and our
fellow beer drinkers!) were a continual pleasure to spend time with - while eating great food and drinking great beer.  Highly recommend!

originalText.text: Highly recommended! The Belgian & France tour was a blast, great food and tastings, super well organized and met loads of new friends on the trip. The many beer tours to the breweries like De Ranke, de Struise, Drei Fonteinen, Cantillon and all the others were almost an insiders only experience, as all were great friends with Joel and his team.  A must try for beer lovers of any age.
